data.eml:eml: NDFF Comprehensive mapping of flora and fauna in Provence of Utrecht

This project aims to comprehensively map the flora and fauna, and thereby the environmental value in Utrecht. The data is mostly used to answer questions concerning environmental planning and nature legislation (the Flora and Fauna Act and the Nature Conservation Act).The provincial department has been collecting comprehensive data about flora since 1975, and collecting data about fauna with sample surveys since 1988. Since 2005, a new method has been applied to flora and fauna surveys. This method aims to comprehensively survey flora and fauna as much as possible. It maps a selection of species called the ‘mapping species’. These species are selected for their indicative value, rareness and protected status.
